title: elevates
author: elevates
created_time: March 29, 2023, 12:52:27 PMLast edit: March 31, 2023, 02:58:38 AM by elevates
content: Recently I came across a few articles on the Internet while trying to understand what makes sports betting so lucrative. I now know that there are three big sports that every Gambler, Sports Enthusiast, and a lot of fans are engaged in Sports betting. I personally have not seen or realized it but a good majority of teens & preteens are already into it. I hope everyone would agree with this list:SoccerBasketballCricketUFCThis list is not based on betting revenue or based on the number of fans. It is simply compiled by me after watching the activity on this board for different games thread. I am aware that I did not add Tennis, Automobile racing, and Boxing as my question is about those sports that are not being discussed here but you do bet on them either occasionally or regularly.

comments.body: Quote from: elevates on March 29, 2023, 12:52:27 PMI am aware that I did not add Tennis, MMA and Boxing as my question is about those sports that are not being discussed here but you do bet on it either occasionally or on a regular basis.Soccer (football) is mostly discussed on gambling discussion board. I believe it is the sport bet that is most common among people, including virtual sport betting too. The matches that I like to gamble most on is football, including the in-play and also virtual footballs predictions.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: I think boxing is more popular than UFC considering of how many threads are created for boxing match and most of them are active. MMA isn't really popular because most people think UFC is MMA or MMA is UFC  even though there are many other MMA promotions too e.g. KSW, PFL, Bellator etc. Sometime I bet on Formula1 and MotoGP for fun, it's really unexpected to predict the winner.

In fact, I doubt anyone here even recognizes that word other than Americans.I would gladly bet on any sport as long as I get good odds and understand a minimum amount about that sport and the history of the players involved. You do not need to be a genius to research a players past history of wins/losses. Thats universal for any sport.As far as to your question of specifically which sport which is not listed here that I would love to bet on:Asian martial art/other fighting styles which are not that prominent in western society. comments.author: tokeweed
comments.body: I like betting on Starcraft/Broodwar even though I'm losing overall because I'm really bad at it.  Lol.  That game for me is some sort of a guilty pleasure these days.  Lol.  I shouldn't be watching it.  But as a little kid I used play it a lot as my older brother and older cousins played it a lot too, both online and at LAN parties.  It's still by far the best RTS game in existence and I'd go far to say that any man, woman or child who says that there's some other RTS game that's better, I'd tell them they have no idea what they're talking about.  Lolol.

comments.author: kenshi222
comments.body: Sportsbet is mostly based on this three major games all the time.The first places goes to the Football,even though only 52 games qualify for the FIFA world.Huge number of the countries try to build their own country to target on next FIFA.The most of the sports betting was made on the football and the gambling sites owner also follow the same.Because the competition only allow the betting and winning of the game.The gambling sites second with the interest of Cricket games.Because the betting was placed on Test matches separately,the test matches also includes the ashes match.Which was done against the Australia,New Zealand and England teams.Their will be separate leagues for ODI One day games and it also had separate game for the woman.The cricket also includes T20 IPL matches,which occur every year.Every matches had two teams,which make easy for Sportsbet.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: It depends on which sport I like and which sport I personally understand the best. I can't remember if I had ever placed a bet for sports other than Cricket and soccer. In Asian countries, these two are the most popular sports and people understand these two perfectly. Though personally, I place most of the bets in soccer (Place bets on cricket occasionally), most people here place bets on cricket matches. I don't even anymore watch any other sports for a quite long time.

comments.body: I'm a pure football bettor, I almost never bet on other sports, I've tried betting on UFC - basket ball (NBA) - boxing but I'm quite difficult to understand it, so I decided to only bet on football.right now I'm trying to bet on e-sport, but the results are not good, I even have trouble finding references

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: For me I think it's either football, UFC, boxing and basketball are the most discussed sports in this board, I mean the majority. Mostly I do on basketball and seldomly on football. I think as a sport bettor you mostly focus on two or three sports and if by chance you're interested on other sports that wouldn't take much more time as long as it's not your favorite sports to bet to.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: I used to bet on motor racing events. I know some may not consider that as a sport but it is to me. I like the thrill and I've gotten to know the top contenders every season but the interest just wasn't enough to keep me betting. I also don't have enough bankroll to gamble on different sports so I stick to football and basketball hehe.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: I'm not sure if I've ever bet on a cricket match, and I can't even remember the last time I sat down to watch cricket.Football, NBA, and boxing are my favorites, but football is the one on which I place the most bets. That is in terms of betting, but in terms of debate, my favorite is NBA. There is never a dull moment when discussing the NBA, but unfortunately for me, my predictions don't always come true, and I end up losing my bets in the end.
